  151: %%======================================================================
  152: %% Common Test interface functions
  153: %%======================================================================
  154: 
  155: suite() -> 
  156:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]}].
  157: 
  158: all() -> 
  159:     %% This is a temporary measure to ensure that we can 
  160:     %% test the socket backend without effecting *all*
  161:     %% applications on *all* machines.
  162:     %% This flag is set only for *one* host.
  163:     case ?TEST_INET_BACKENDS() of
  164:         true ->
  165:             [
  166:              {group, inet_backend_default},
  167:              {group, inet_backend_inet},
  168:              {group, inet_backend_socket}
  169:             ];
  170:         _ ->
  171:             [
  172:              {group, inet_backend_default}
  173:             ]
  174:     end.
  175: 
  176: groups() -> 
  177:     [
  178:      {inet_backend_default, [], inet_backend_default_cases()},
  179:      {inet_backend_inet,    [], inet_backend_inet_cases()},
  180:      {inet_backend_socket,  [], inet_backend_socket_cases()},
  181: 
  182:      {all,                  [], all_cases()},
  183:      {start_and_stop_tests, [], start_and_stop_tests_cases()},
  184:      {misc_tests,           [], misc_tests_cases()},
  185:      {usm_priv_aes_tests,   [], usm_priv_aes_tests_cases()},
  186:      {user_tests,           [], user_tests_cases()},
  187:      {agent_tests,          [], agent_tests_cases()},
  188:      {request_tests,        [], request_tests_cases()},
  189:      {request_tests_mt,     [], request_tests_mt_cases()},
  190:      {get_tests,            [], get_tests_cases()},
  191:      {get_next_tests,       [], get_next_tests_cases()},
  192:      {set_tests,            [], set_tests_cases()},
  193:      {bulk_tests,           [], bulk_tests_cases()},
  194:      {event_tests,          [], event_tests_cases()},
  195:      {event_tests_mt,       [], event_tests_mt_cases()},
  196:      {tickets,              [], tickets_cases()},
  197:      {otp8015,              [], otp8015_cases()},
  198:      {otp8395,              [], otp8395_cases()},
  199:      {ipv6,                 [], ipv6_tests()},
  200:      {ipv6_mt,              [], ipv6_tests()},
  201: 
  202:      {v3,                   [], v3_cases()}
  203:     ].
  204: 
  205: inet_backend_default_cases() ->
  206:     [{all, [], all_cases()}].
  207: 
  208: inet_backend_inet_cases() ->
  209:     [{all, [], all_cases()}].
  210: 
  211: inet_backend_socket_cases() ->
  212:     [{all, [], all_cases()}].
  213:

  220:      {group, agent_tests},
  221:      {group, request_tests},
  222:      {group, request_tests_mt},
  223:      {group, event_tests},
  224:      {group, event_tests_mt},
  225:      discovery,
  226:      {group, tickets},

  228:      {group, ipv6_mt},
  229:      {group, v3}
  230:     ].

  368: %%
  369: %% -----
  370: %%
  371: 
  372: init_per_suite(Config0) when is_list(Config0) ->
  373: 
  374:     ?IPRINT("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  375:             "~n      Config0: ~p"
  376:             "~n      Nodes:  ~p"
  377:             "~n      explicit inet backend: ~p"
  378:             "~n      test inet backends:    ~p",
  379:             [Config0, erlang:nodes(),
  380:              ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND(),
  381:              ?TEST_INET_BACKENDS()]),
  382: 
  383:     case ?LIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  384:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  385:             SKIP;
  386: 
  387:         Config1 ->
  388: 
  389:             ?IPRINT("init_per_suite -> common init done"
  390:                     "~n      Config1: ~p", [Config1]),
  391: 
  392:             %% We need one on this node also
  393:             snmp_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  394: 
  395:             Config2   = ?LIB:init_suite_top_dir(?MODULE, Config1), 
  396:             Config3   = ?LIB:fix_data_dir(Config2),
  397:             %% Mib-dirs
  398:             %% data_dir is trashed by the test-server / common-test
  399:             %% so there is no point in fixing it...
  400:             MibDir    = ?LIB:lookup(data_dir, Config3),
  401:             StdMibDir = filename:join([code:priv_dir(snmp), "mibs"]),
  402:             [{mib_dir, MibDir}, {std_mib_dir, StdMibDir} | Config3]
  403: 
  404:     end.
  405: 
  406: end_per_suite(Config0) when is_list(Config0) ->
  407: 
  408:     ?IPRINT("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  409:             "~n      Config0: ~p"
  410:             "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  411: 
  412:     snmp_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  413:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  414: 
  415:     ?IPRINT("end_per_suite -> end when"
  416:             "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  417:     Config1.
  418: 
  419: 
  420: %%
  421: %% -----
  422: %%
  423: 
  424: init_per_group(GroupName, Config0) ->
  425:     ?IPRINT("init_per_group -> entry with"
  426:             "~n      GroupName: ~p"
  427:             "~n      Config:    ~p"
  428:             "~n   when"
  429:             "~n      Nodes:     ~p",
  430:             [GroupName, Config0, nodes()]),
  431: 
  432:     Config1 = init_per_group2(GroupName, Config0),
  433: 
  434:     ?IPRINT("init_per_group -> done when"
  435:             "~n      GroupName: ~p"
  436:             "~n      Config:    ~p"
  437:             "~n      Nodes:     ~p",
  438:             [GroupName, Config1, nodes()]),
  439: 
  440:     Config1.
  441: 
  442: 
  443: init_per_group2(inet_backend_default = _GroupName, Config0) ->
  444:     Config1 = [{socket_create_opts, []} | Config0],
  445:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  446:         true ->
  447:             ?LIB:init_group_top_dir(default, Config1);
  448:         false ->
  449:             %% For a "standard" test (that is if we do not run the "extended"
  450:             %% inet backends test) then we should always run this group!
  451:             %% So, if we have an extended test, *then* (and only then) 
  452:             %% check the factor.
  453:             case ?TEST_INET_BACKENDS() of
  454:                 true ->
  455:                     case lists:keysearch(snmp_factor, 1, Config0) of
  456:                         {value, {snmp_factor, Factor}} when (Factor < 3) ->
  457:                             ?LIB:init_group_top_dir(default, Config1);
  458:                         _ ->
  459:                             {skip, "Machine too slow"}
  460:                     end;
  461:                 _ ->
  462:                     ?LIB:init_group_top_dir(default, Config1)
  463:             end                    
  464:     end;
  465: init_per_group2(inet_backend_inet = _GroupName, Config0) ->
  466:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  467:         true ->
  468:             %% The environment trumps us,
  469:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  470:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  471:         false ->
  472:             case lists:keysearch(snmp_factor, 1, Config0) of
  473:                 {value, {snmp_factor, Factor}} when (Factor < 5) ->
  474:                     Config1 = [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, inet}]} |
  475:                                Config0],
  476:                     ?LIB:init_group_top_dir(inet, Config1);
  477:                 _ ->
  478:                     {skip, "Machine too slow"}
  479:             end
  480:     end;
  481: init_per_group2(inet_backend_socket = _GroupName, Config0) ->
  482:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  483:         true ->
  484:             %% The environment trumps us,
  485:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  486:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  487:         false ->
  488:             %% Always run this unless a backend has been explicitly
  489:             %% configured (since this is really what we want to test).
  490:             Config1 = [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, socket}]} |
  491:                        Config0],
  492:             ?LIB:init_group_top_dir(socket, Config1)
  493:     end;
  494: init_per_group2(all = GroupName, Config) ->
  495:     ?LIB:init_group_top_dir(GroupName, Config);
  496: init_per_group2(request_tests_mt = GroupName, Config) ->
  497:     ?LIB:init_group_top_dir(
  498:       GroupName,
  499:       [{manager_net_if_module, snmpm_net_if_mt} | Config]);
  500: init_per_group2(event_tests_mt = GroupName, Config) ->
  501:     ?LIB:init_group_top_dir(
  502:       GroupName,
  503:       [{manager_net_if_module, snmpm_net_if_mt} | Config]);
  504: init_per_group2(ipv6_mt = GroupName, Config) ->
  505:     init_per_group_ipv6(GroupName,
  506:                         [{manager_net_if_module, snmpm_net_if_mt} | Config]);   
  507: init_per_group2(ipv6 = GroupName, Config) ->
  508:     init_per_group_ipv6(GroupName, Config);
  509: init_per_group2(v3 = GroupName, Config) ->
  510:     case ?CRYPTO_START() of
  511: 	ok ->
  512:             ?IPRINT("crypto started - check support"),
  513:             case ?CRYPTO_SUPPORT() of
  514:                 {no, Reason} ->
  515:                     ?WPRINT("crypto support not sufficient:"
  516:                             "~n      ~p", [Reason]),
  517:                     {skip, {unsupported_encryption, Reason}};
  518:                 yes ->
  519:                     ?IPRINT("crypto supported"),
  520:                     ?LIB:init_group_top_dir(GroupName, Config)
  521:                 end;
  522: 	{error, Reason} ->
  523:             ?IPRINT("crypto not started:"
  524:                     "~n      ~p", [Reason]),
  525: 	    {skip, {failed_starting_crypto, Reason}}
  526:     end;
  527: init_per_group2(usm_priv_aes_tests = GroupName, Config) ->
  528:     %% Check crypto support
  529:     case snmp_misc:is_crypto_supported(aes_128_cfb128) of
  530:         true ->
  531:             ?LIB:init_group_top_dir(GroupName, Config);
  532:         false ->
  533:             throw({skip, {not_supported, aes_128_cfb128}})
  534:     end;
  535: init_per_group2(GroupName, Config) ->
  536:     ?LIB:init_group_top_dir(GroupName, Config).
  537: 
  538: 
  539: init_per_group_ipv6(GroupName, Config) ->
  540:     %% <OS-CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
  541:     OSSkipable = [{unix, 
  542:                    [
  543:                     {darwin, fun(V) when (V > {9, 8, 0}) ->
  544: 				     %% This version is OK: No Skip
  545: 				     false;
  546: 				(_) ->
  547: 				     %% This version is *not* ok: Skip
  548:                                      %% We need a fully qualified hostname
  549:                                      %% to get a proper IPv6 address (in this
  550:                                      %% version), but its just to messy, so 
  551:                                      %% instead we skip this **OLD** darwin...
  552: 				     true
  553:                              end}
  554:                    ]
  555:                   }],
  556:     %% </OS-CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
  557:     case ?OS_BASED_SKIP(OSSkipable) of
  558:         true ->
  559:             {skip, "Host *may* not *properly* support IPV6"};
  560:         false ->
  561:             %% Even if this host supports IPv6 we don't use it unless its
  562:             %% one of the configures/supported IPv6 hosts...
  563:             case ?HAS_SUPPORT_IPV6() of
  564:                 true ->
  565:                     ipv6_init(?LIB:init_group_top_dir(GroupName, Config));
  566:                 false ->
  567:                     {skip, "Host does not support IPv6"}
  568:             end
  569:     end.
  570: 
  571: 
  572: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  573:     %% Do we really need to do this?
  574:     lists:keydelete(snmp_group_top_dir, 1, Config).
  575: 
  576: 
  577: 
  578: 
  579: %%
  580: %% -----
  581: %%
  582: 
  583: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  584: 
  585:     ?IPRINT("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  586:             "~n   Config: ~p"
  587:             "~n   Nodes:  ~p", [Config, erlang:nodes()]),
  588: 
  589:     snmp_test_global_sys_monitor:reset_events(),
  590:     
  591:     %% This version of the API, based on Addr and Port, has been deprecated
  592:     DeprecatedApiCases = 
  593: 	[
  594: 	],
  595:     Result = 
  596: 	case lists:member(Case, DeprecatedApiCases) of
  597: 	    true ->
  598: 		{skip, "API no longer supported"};
  599: 	    false ->
  600: 		try init_per_testcase2(Case, Config)
  601:                 catch
  602:                     C:{skip, _} = E:_ when ((C =:= throw) orelse
  603:                                             (C =:= exit)) ->
  604:                         E;
  605:                     exit:{suite_failed, {{Reason, _CS},_MFA}, Mod, Line}:_ ->
  606:                         {skip, {Reason, Mod, Line}};
  607:                     exit:{suite_failed, Reason, Mod, Line}:_ ->
  608:                         {skip, {Reason, Mod, Line}};
  609:                     C:E:_ when ((C =:= throw) orelse
  610:                                 (C =:= exit)) ->
  611:                         {skip, {caught, C, E}}
  612:                 end
  613: 	end,
  614:     ?IPRINT("init_per_testcase end when"
  615:             "~n      Nodes:  ~p"
  616:             "~n      Result: ~p"
  617:             "~n~n", [erlang:nodes(), Result]),
  618:     Result.
  619: 
  620: init_per_testcase2(Case, Config) ->
  621:     ?DBG("init_per_testcase2 -> "
  622: 	 "~n   Case:   ~p"
  623: 	 "~n   Config: ~p"
  624: 	 "~n   Nodes:  ~p", [Case, Config, erlang:nodes()]),
  625: 
  626:     CaseTopDir = snmp_test_lib:init_testcase_top_dir(Case, Config), 
  627: 
  628:     %% -- Manager dirs  --
  629:     MgrTopDir  = filename:join(CaseTopDir, "manager/"), 
  630:     ?DBG("init_per_testcase2 -> try create manager top dir: ~n~p", 
  631: 	 [MgrTopDir]),
  632:     ok   = file:make_dir(MgrTopDir),
  633: 
  634:     MgrConfDir = filename:join(MgrTopDir,  "conf/"),
  635:     ok   = file:make_dir(MgrConfDir),
  636: 
  637:     MgrDbDir   = filename:join(MgrTopDir,  "db/"),
  638:     ok   = file:make_dir(MgrDbDir),
  639: 
  640:     MgrLogDir  = filename:join(MgrTopDir,  "log/"),
  641:     ok   = file:make_dir(MgrLogDir),
  642: 
  643:     %% -- Agent dirs --
  644:     AgTopDir  = filename:join(CaseTopDir, "agent/"),
  645:     ok  = file:make_dir(AgTopDir),
  646: 
  647:     AgConfDir = filename:join(AgTopDir,   "conf/"),
  648:     ok  = file:make_dir(AgConfDir),
  649: 
  650:     AgDbDir   = filename:join(AgTopDir,   "db/"),
  651:     ok  = file:make_dir(AgDbDir),
  652: 
  653:     AgLogDir  = filename:join(AgTopDir,   "log/"),
  654:     ok  = file:make_dir(AgLogDir),
  655: 
  656:     Family = proplists:get_value(ipfamily, Config, inet),
  657: 
  658:     Factor = ?config(snmp_factor, Config),
  659:     TO = case Case of
  660:              inform3 ->
  661:                  ?MINS(2 + (Factor div 2));
  662:              InformSwarm when (InformSwarm =:= inform_swarm_cbp_def) orelse
  663:                               (InformSwarm =:= inform_swarm_cbp_temp) orelse
  664:                               (InformSwarm =:= inform_swarm_cbp_perm) ->
  665:                  ?MINS(1 + Factor);
  666:              _ ->
  667:                  ?MINS(1 + (Factor div 2))
  668:          end,
  669:     ?IPRINT("Set test case timetrap: ~p", [TO]),
  670:     ct:timetrap(TO),
  671: 
  672:     Conf = [{ipfamily,                  Family},
  673: 	    {ip,                        ?LOCALHOST(Family)},
  674: 	    {case_top_dir,              CaseTopDir},
  675: 	    {agent_dir,                 AgTopDir},
  676: 	    {agent_conf_dir,            AgConfDir},
  677: 	    {agent_db_dir,              AgDbDir},
  678: 	    {agent_log_dir,             AgLogDir}, 
  679: 	    {manager_agent_target_name, "agent01"}, 
  680: 	    {manager_dir,               MgrTopDir},
  681: 	    {manager_conf_dir,          MgrConfDir},
  682: 	    {manager_db_dir,            MgrDbDir},
  683: 	    {manager_log_dir,           MgrLogDir} | Config],
  684:     Conf2 = init_per_testcase3(Case, Conf),
  685:     ?DBG("init [~w] Nodes [2]: ~p", [Case, erlang:nodes()]),
  686:     Conf2.
  687: 
  688: init_per_testcase3(simple_v3_exchange_md5 = Case, Config) ->
  689:     init_v3_testcase(Case, [{auth_alg, md5} | Config]);
  690: init_per_testcase3(simple_v3_exchange_sha = Case, Config) ->
  691:     init_v3_testcase(Case, [{auth_alg, sha} | Config]);
  692: init_per_testcase3(simple_v3_exchange_sha224 = Case, Config) ->
  693:     init_v3_testcase(Case, [{auth_alg, sha224} | Config]);
  694: init_per_testcase3(simple_v3_exchange_sha256 = Case, Config) ->
  695:     init_v3_testcase(Case, [{auth_alg, sha256} | Config]);
  696: init_per_testcase3(simple_v3_exchange_sha384 = Case, Config) ->
  697:     init_v3_testcase(Case, [{auth_alg, sha384} | Config]);
  698: init_per_testcase3(simple_v3_exchange_sha512 = Case, Config) ->
  699:     init_v3_testcase(Case, [{auth_alg, sha512} | Config]);
  700: init_per_testcase3(Case, Config) ->
  701:     ApiCases02 = 
  702: 	[
  703: 	 otp8395_1
  704: 	],
  705:     ApiCases03 = 
  706: 	[
  707: 	 simple_sync_get3,
  708: 	 simple_async_get3,
  709: 	 simple_sync_get_next3,
  710: 	 simple_async_get_next3_cbp_def,
  711: 	 simple_async_get_next3_cbp_temp,
  712: 	 simple_async_get_next3_cbp_perm,
  713: 	 simple_sync_set3,
  714: 	 simple_async_set3_cbp_def,
  715: 	 simple_async_set3_cbp_temp,
  716: 	 simple_async_set3_cbp_perm,
  717: 	 simple_sync_get_bulk3,
  718:          simple_async_get_bulk3_cbp_def,
  719:          simple_async_get_bulk3_cbp_temp,
  720:          simple_async_get_bulk3_cbp_perm
  721: 	],
  722:     Cases = 
  723: 	[
  724: 	 trap1,
  725: 	 trap2,
  726: 	 inform1,
  727: 	 inform2,
  728: 	 inform3,
  729: 	 inform4,
  730: 	 inform_swarm_cbp_def,
  731:          inform_swarm_cbp_temp,
  732:          inform_swarm_cbp_perm,
  733: 	 report
  734: 	] ++ 
  735: 	ApiCases02 ++
  736: 	ApiCases03,
  737:     case lists:member(Case, Cases) of
  738: 	true ->
  739: 	    NoAutoInformCases = [inform1, inform2, inform3,
  740:                                  inform_swarm_cbp_def,
  741:                                  inform_swarm_cbp_temp,
  742:                                  inform_swarm_cbp_perm], 
  743: 	    AutoInform = not lists:member(Case, NoAutoInformCases),
  744: 	    Conf1 = if 
  745:                         %% We turn off verbosity for the swarm cases
  746:                         %% (too much output).
  747: 			(Case =:= inform_swarm_cbp_def) orelse
  748:                         (Case =:= inform_swarm_cbp_temp) orelse
  749:                         (Case =:= inform_swarm_cbp_perm) ->
  750: 			    Verb = [{manager_config_verbosity,     silence},
  751:                                     {manager_note_store_verbosity, silence},
  752:                                     {manager_server_verbosity,     info},
  753:                                     {manager_net_if_verbosity,     info},
  754:                                     {agent_verbosity,              info}, 
  755:                                     {agent_net_if_verbosity,       info}],
  756:                             Verb ++ Config;
  757: 			Case =:= otp8395_1 ->
  758: 			    [{manager_atl_seqno, true} | Config];
  759: 			true ->
  760: 			    Config
  761: 		    end,
  762:             Conf2 = if
  763:                         (Case =:= simple_async_get_next3_cbp_temp) orelse
  764:                         (Case =:= simple_async_set3_cbp_temp) orelse
  765:                         (Case =:= simple_async_get_bulk3_cbp_temp) orelse
  766:                         (Case =:= inform_swarm_cbp_temp) ->
  767:                             [{manager_server_cbproxy, temporary} | Conf1];
  768:                         (Case =:= simple_async_get_next3_cbp_perm) orelse
  769:                         (Case =:= simple_async_set3_cbp_perm) orelse
  770:                         (Case =:= simple_async_get_bulk3_cbp_perm) orelse
  771:                         (Case =:= inform_swarm_cbp_perm) ->
  772:                             [{manager_server_cbproxy, permanent} | Conf1];
  773:                         true ->
  774:                             Conf1
  775:                     end,
  776:             %% We don't need to try catch this (init_agent)
  777:             %% since we have a try catch "higher up"...
  778: 	    Conf3 = init_agent(Case, Conf2),
  779: 	    Conf4 = try init_manager(Case, AutoInform, Conf3)
  780:                     catch AC:AE:_ ->
  781:                             %% Ouch we need to clean up: 
  782:                             %% The init_agent starts an agent node!
  783:                             init_per_testcase_fail_agent_cleanup(Conf2),
  784:                             throw({skip, {manager_init_failed, AC, AE}})
  785:                     end,
  786: 	    Conf5 = try init_mgr_user(Conf4)
  787:                     catch MC:ME:_ ->
  788:                             %% Ouch we need to clean up: 
  789:                             %% The init_agent starts an agent node!
  790:                             %% The init_magager starts an manager node!
  791:                             init_per_testcase_fail_manager_cleanup(Conf3),
  792:                             init_per_testcase_fail_agent_cleanup(Conf3),
  793:                             throw({skip, {manager_user_init_failed, MC, ME}})
  794:                     end,
  795: 	    case lists:member(Case, ApiCases02 ++ ApiCases03) of
  796: 		true ->
  797: 		    init_mgr_user_data2(Conf5);
  798: 		false ->
  799: 		    init_mgr_user_data1(Conf5)
  800: 	    end;
  801: 	false ->
  802: 	    Config
  803:     end.
  804: 
  805: init_v3_testcase(Case, Conf) ->
  806:     Conf2 = init_v3_agent(Case, Conf),
  807:     Conf3 = try init_v3_manager(Case, Conf2)
  808:             catch AC:AE:AS ->
  809:                     %% Ouch we need to clean up:
  810:                     %% The init_agent starts an agent node!
  811:                     ?IPRINT("init_v3_testcase -> failed init v3 manager:"
  812:                             "~n      AC: ~p"
  813:                             "~n      AE: ~p"
  814:                             "~n      AS: ~p", [AC, AE, AS]),
  815:                     init_per_testcase_fail_agent_cleanup(Conf),
  816:                     throw({skip, {manager_init_failed, AC, AE}})
  817:             end,
  818:     Conf4 = try init_mgr_v3_user(Conf3)
  819:             catch MC:ME:MS ->
  820:                     %% Ouch we need to clean up:
  821:                     %% The init_agent starts an agent node!
  822:                     %% The init_magager starts an manager node!
  823:                     ?IPRINT("init_v3_testcase -> failed init v3 manager user:"
  824:                             "~n      MC: ~p"
  825:                             "~n      ME: ~p"
  826:                             "~n      MS: ~p", [MC, ME, MS]),
  827:                     init_per_testcase_fail_manager_cleanup(Conf2),
  828:                     init_per_testcase_fail_agent_cleanup(Conf2),
  829:                     throw({skip, {manager_user_init_failed, MC, ME}})
  830:             end,
  831:     init_mgr_v3_user_data(Conf4).
  832: 
  833: init_per_testcase_fail_manager_cleanup(Conf) ->
  834:     (catch fin_manager(Conf)).
  835: 
  836: init_per_testcase_fail_agent_cleanup(Conf) ->
  837:     (catch fin_agent(Conf)).
  838: 
  839: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  840:     ?IPRINT("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  841:             "~n   Config:        ~p"
  842:             "~n   Nodes:         ~p",
  843:             [Config, erlang:nodes()]),
  844: 
  845:     ?IPRINT("system events during test: "
  846:             "~n   ~p", [snmp_test_global_sys_monitor:events()]),
  847: 
  848:     Conf1  = Config,
  849:     Conf2  = end_per_testcase2(Case, Conf1),
  850: 
  851:     ?IPRINT("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  852:             "~n   Config: ~p"
  853:             "~n   Nodes:  ~p", [Conf2, erlang:nodes()]),
  854: 
  855:     Conf2.
  856: 
  857: end_per_testcase2(Case, Config)
  858:   when ((Case =:= simple_v3_exchange_md5)    orelse
  859:         (Case =:= simple_v3_exchange_sha)    orelse
  860:         (Case =:= simple_v3_exchange_sha224) orelse
  861:         (Case =:= simple_v3_exchange_sha256) orelse
  862:         (Case =:= simple_v3_exchange_sha384) orelse
  863:         (Case =:= simple_v3_exchange_sha512)) ->
  864:     Conf1 = fin_mgr_user_data2(Config),
  865:     Conf2 = fin_mgr_user(Conf1),
  866:     Conf3 = fin_v3_manager(Conf2),
  867:     fin_v3_agent(Conf3);
  868: end_per_testcase2(Case, Config) ->
  869:     ApiCases02 = 
  870: 	[
  871: 	 otp8395_1
  872: 	],
  873:     ApiCases03 = 
  874: 	[
  875: 	 simple_sync_get3, 
  876: 	 simple_async_get3, 
  877: 	 simple_sync_get_next3, 
  878: 	 simple_async_get_next3_cbp_def, 
  879: 	 simple_async_get_next3_cbp_temp, 
  880: 	 simple_async_get_next3_cbp_perm, 
  881: 	 simple_sync_set3, 
  882: 	 simple_async_set3_cbp_def,
  883: 	 simple_async_set3_cbp_temp,
  884: 	 simple_async_set3_cbp_perm,
  885: 	 simple_sync_get_bulk3, 
  886:          simple_async_get_bulk3_cbp_def,
  887:          simple_async_get_bulk3_cbp_temp,
  888:          simple_async_get_bulk3_cbp_perm
  889: 	],
  890:     Cases = 
  891: 	[
  892: 	 trap1,
  893: 	 trap2,
  894: 	 inform1,
  895: 	 inform2,
  896: 	 inform3,
  897: 	 inform4,
  898:          inform_swarm_cbp_def,
  899:          inform_swarm_cbp_temp,
  900:          inform_swarm_cbp_perm,
  901: 	 report
  902: 	] ++ 
  903: 	ApiCases02 ++ 
  904: 	ApiCases03,
  905:     case lists:member(Case, Cases) of
  906: 	true ->
  907: 	    Conf1 = case lists:member(Case, ApiCases02 ++ ApiCases03) of
  908: 			true ->
  909: 			    fin_mgr_user_data2(Config);
  910: 			false ->
  911: 			    fin_mgr_user_data1(Config)
  912: 		    end,
  913: 	    Conf2 = fin_mgr_user(Conf1),
  914: 	    Conf3 = fin_manager(Conf2),
  915: 	    fin_agent(Conf3);
  916: 	false ->
  917: 	    Config
  918:     end.
  919: 
  920: 
  921: %%======================================================================
  922: %% Test case definitions
  923: %%======================================================================
  924:

  928: %%======================================================================
  929: 
  930: simple_start_and_stop1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  931:     ?TC_TRY(simple_start_and_stop1,
  932:             fun() -> do_simple_start_and_stop1(Config) end).
  933: 
  934: do_simple_start_and_stop1(Config) ->
  935:     ?IPRINT("starting with Config: "
  936:             "~n      ~p", [Config]),
  937:     SCO     = ?config(socket_create_opts, Config),
  938:     ConfDir = ?config(manager_conf_dir,   Config),
  939:     DbDir   = ?config(manager_db_dir,     Config),
  940: 
  941:     write_manager_conf(ConfDir),
  942: 
  943:     Opts = [{server,     [{verbosity, trace}]},
  944: 	    {net_if,     [{verbosity, trace}, {options, SCO}]},
  945: 	    {note_store, [{verbosity, trace}]},
  946: 	    {config,     [{verbosity, trace}, {dir, ConfDir}, {db_dir, DbDir}]}],
  947: 
  948:     ?IPRINT("try starting manager"),
  949:     ok = snmpm:start_link(Opts),
  950: 
  951:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  952: 
  953:     ?IPRINT("manager started, now try to stop"),
  954:     ok = snmpm:stop(),
  955: 
  956:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  957: 
  958:     ok.
  959: 
  960: 
  961: %%======================================================================
  962: 
  963: simple_start_and_stop2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  964:     Pre  = fun() ->
  965:                    ManagerNode = start_node(simple_start_and_stop2),
  966:                    [ManagerNode]
  967:            end,
  968:     Case = fun(State) -> do_simple_start_and_stop2(State, Config) end,
  969:     Post = fun([{ManagerPeer, _ManagerNode}]) -> peer:stop(ManagerPeer) end,
  970:     ?TC_TRY(simple_start_and_stop2, Pre, Case, Post).
  971: 
  972: do_simple_start_and_stop2([{_ManagerPeer, ManagerNode}], Config) ->
  973:     ?IPRINT("starting with Config: "
  974:             "~n      ~p"
  975:             "~n", [Config]),
  976: 
  977:     SCO     = ?config(socket_create_opts, Config),
  978:     ConfDir = ?config(manager_conf_dir,   Config),
  979:     DbDir   = ?config(manager_db_dir,     Config),
  980: 
  981:     write_manager_conf(ConfDir),
  982: 
  983:     Opts = [{server,     [{verbosity, trace}]},
  984: 	    {net_if,     [{verbosity, trace}, {options, SCO}]},
  985: 	    {note_store, [{verbosity, trace}]},
  986: 	    {config,     [{verbosity, trace}, {dir, ConfDir}, {db_dir, DbDir}]}],
  987: 
  988: 
  989:     ?IPRINT("try load snmp application"),
  990:     ok = load_snmp(ManagerNode),
  991: 
  992:     ?IPRINT("try set manager env for the snmp application"),
  993:     ok = set_mgr_env(ManagerNode, Opts),
  994: 
  995:     ?IPRINT("try starting snmp application (with only manager)"),
  996:     ok = start_snmp(ManagerNode),
  997: 
  998:     ?IPRINT("started"),
  999: 
 1000:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 1001: 
 1002:     ?IPRINT("try stopping snmp application (with only manager)"),
 1003:     ok = stop_snmp(ManagerNode),
 1004: 
 1005:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 1006:     ?IPRINT("end"),
 1007: 
 1008:     ok.
 1009: 
 1010: 
 1011: %%======================================================================
 1012: 
 1013: simple_start_and_stop3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1014:     ?TC_TRY(simple_start_and_stop3,
 1015:             fun() -> do_simple_start_and_stop3(Config) end).
 1016: 
 1017: do_simple_start_and_stop3(Config) ->
 1018:     ?IPRINT("starting with Config: "
 1019:             "~n      ~p", [Config]),
 1020: 
 1021:     SCO     = ?config(socket_create_opts, Config),
 1022:     ConfDir = ?config(manager_conf_dir, Config),
 1023:     DbDir   = ?config(manager_db_dir, Config),
 1024: 
 1025:     write_manager_conf(ConfDir),
 1026: 
 1027:     Opts = [{server,     [{verbosity, trace}]},
 1028: 	    {net_if,     [{verbosity, trace},
 1029:                           {options,   SCO ++ [{extra_sock_opts, ['this-should-not-work']}]}]},
 1030: 	    {note_store, [{verbosity, trace}]},
 1031: 	    {config,     [{verbosity, trace}, {dir, ConfDir}, {db_dir, DbDir}]}],
 1032: 
 1033:     ?IPRINT("try starting manager"),
 1034:     try snmpm:start_link(Opts) of
 1035:         ok ->
 1036:             (catch snmpm:stop()),
 1037:             ?FAIL('unexpected-success')
 1038:     catch
 1039:         _:_:_ ->
 1040:             ?IPRINT("expected start failure"),
 1041:             ok
 1042:     end,
 1043: 
 1044:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 1045:     ?IPRINT("end"),
 1046: 
 1047:     ok.
 1048: 
 1049: 
 1050: %%======================================================================
 1051: 
 1052: simple_start_and_monitor_crash1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1053:     ?TC_TRY(simple_start_and_monitor_crash1,
 1054:             fun() -> do_simple_start_and_monitor_crash1(Config) end).
 1055: 
 1056: do_simple_start_and_monitor_crash1(Config) ->
 1057:     ?IPRINT("starting with Config: "
 1058:             "~n      ~p", [Config]),
 1059: 
 1060:     SCO     = ?config(socket_create_opts, Config),
 1061:     ConfDir = ?config(manager_conf_dir,   Config),
 1062:     DbDir   = ?config(manager_db_dir,     Config),
 1063: 
 1064:     write_manager_conf(ConfDir),
 1065: 
 1066:     Opts = [{server,     [{verbosity, trace}]},
 1067: 	    {net_if,     [{verbosity, trace}, {options, SCO}]},
 1068: 	    {note_store, [{verbosity, trace}]},
 1069: 	    {config,     [{verbosity, trace}, {dir, ConfDir}, {db_dir, DbDir}]}],
 1070: 
 1071:     ?IPRINT("try starting manager"),
 1072:     ok = snmpm:start(Opts),
 1073: 
 1074:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 1075: 
 1076:     ?IPRINT("create the monitor"),
 1077:     Ref = snmpm:monitor(),
 1078: 
 1079:     ?IPRINT("make sure it has not already crashed..."),
 1080:     receive
 1081: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Obj1, Reason1} ->
 1082: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_down, Obj1, Reason1})
 1083:     after 1000 ->
 1084: 	    ok
 1085:     end,
 1086: 
 1087:     ?IPRINT("stop the manager"),
 1088:     ok = snmpm:stop(),
 1089: 
 1090:     ?IPRINT("await the down-message"),
 1091:     receive
 1092: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Obj2, Reason2} ->
 1093: 	    ?IPRINT("received expected down-message: "
 1094:                     "~n   Obj2:    ~p"
 1095:                     "~n   Reason2: ~p", 
 1096:                     [Obj2, Reason2]),
 1097: 	    ok
 1098:     after 1000 ->
 1099:             %% The manager is an entire process tree and we can't
 1100:             %% wait for all of them. Instead, we assume that if
 1101:             %% we deal with the top supervisor, all the other procs
 1102:             %% will also follow...
 1103:             ?ENSURE_NOT_RUNNING(snmpm_supervisor,
 1104:                                 fun() -> snmpm:stop() end,
 1105:                                 1000),
 1106: 	    ?FAIL(timeout)
 1107:     end,
 1108:     ?IPRINT("end"),
 1109: 
 1110:     ok.
 1111: 
 1112: 
 1113: %%======================================================================
 1114: 
 1115: simple_start_and_monitor_crash2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1116:     Cond = fun() -> case os:type() of
 1117: 			{unix, netbsd} ->
 1118: 			    {skip, "Unstable on NetBSD"};
 1119: 			_ ->
 1120: 			    ok
 1121: 		    end
 1122: 	   end,
 1123:     Pre  = fun()  -> undefined end,
 1124:     Case = fun(_) -> do_simple_start_and_monitor_crash2(Config) end,
 1125:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1126:     ?TC_TRY(simple_start_and_monitor_crash2,
 1127: 	    Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 1128: 
 1129: do_simple_start_and_monitor_crash2(Config) ->
 1130:     ?IPRINT("starting with Config: "
 1131:             "~n      ~p", [Config]),
 1132: 
 1133:     SCO     = ?config(socket_create_opts, Config),
 1134:     ConfDir = ?config(manager_conf_dir,   Config),
 1135:     DbDir   = ?config(manager_db_dir,     Config),
 1136: 
 1137:     write_manager_conf(ConfDir),
 1138: 
 1139:     Opts = [{restart_type, permanent},
 1140: 	    {server,     [{verbosity, trace}]},
 1141: 	    {net_if,     [{verbosity, trace}, {options, SCO}]},
 1142: 	    {note_store, [{verbosity, trace}]},
 1143: 	    {config,     [{verbosity, trace}, {dir, ConfDir}, {db_dir, DbDir}]}],
 1144: 
 1145:     ?IPRINT("try starting manager"),
 1146:     ok = snmpm:start(Opts),
 1147: 
 1148:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 1149: 
 1150:     ?IPRINT("create the monitor"),
 1151:     Ref = snmpm:monitor(),
 1152: 
 1153:     ?IPRINT("make sure it has not already crashed..."),
 1154:     receive
 1155: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Obj1, Reason1} ->
 1156: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_down, Obj1, Reason1})
 1157:     after 1000 ->
 1158: 	    ok
 1159:     end,
 1160: 
 1161:     ?IPRINT("crash the manager"),
 1162:     simulate_crash(),
 1163: 
 1164:     ?IPRINT("await the down-message"),
 1165:     receive
 1166: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Obj2, Reason2} ->
 1167: 	    ?IPRINT("received expected down-message: "
 1168:                     "~n   Obj2:    ~p"
 1169:                     "~n   Reason2: ~p", 
 1170:                     [Obj2, Reason2]),
 1171: 	    ok
 1172:     after 1000 ->
 1173: 	    ?FAIL(timeout)
 1174:     end,
 1175: 
 1176:     ok.
 1177: 
 1178: 
 1179: %% The server supervisor allow 5 restarts in 500 msec.
 1180: server_pid() ->
 1181:     whereis(snmpm_server).
 1182: 
 1183: -define(MAX_KILLS, 6).
 1184: 
 1185: simulate_crash() ->
 1186:     simulate_crash(0, server_pid()).
 1187: 
 1188: simulate_crash(?MAX_KILLS, _) ->
 1189:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 1190:     case server_pid() of
 1191: 	P when is_pid(P) ->
 1192: 	    exit({error, {still_alive, P}});
 1193: 	_ ->
 1194: 	    ok
 1195:     end;
 1196: simulate_crash(NumKills, Pid) when (NumKills < ?MAX_KILLS) and is_pid(Pid) ->
 1197:     ?IPRINT("similate_crash -> ~w, ~p", [NumKills, Pid]),
 1198:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 1199:     exit(Pid, kill),
 1200:     receive 
 1201: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, _Object, _Info} ->
 1202: 	    ?IPRINT("received expected 'DOWN' message"),
 1203: 	    simulate_crash(NumKills + 1, server_pid())
 1204:     after 1000 ->
 1205: 	    case server_pid() of
 1206: 		P when is_pid(P) ->
 1207:                     ?EPRINT("received expected 'DOWN' message"),
 1208: 		    exit({error, {no_down_from_server, P}});
 1209: 		_ ->
 1210: 		    ok
 1211: 	    end
 1212:     end;
 1213: simulate_crash(NumKills, _) ->
 1214:     ?SLEEP(10),
 1215:     simulate_crash(NumKills, server_pid()).
 1216: 
 1217: 
 1218: %%======================================================================
 1219: 
 1220: notify_started01(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1221:     ?TC_TRY(notify_started01,
 1222:             fun() -> do_notify_started01(Config) end).
 1223: 
 1224: do_notify_started01(Config) ->
 1225:     ?IPRINT("starting with Config: "
 1226:             "~n      ~p", [Config]),
 1227: 
 1228:     SCO     = ?config(socket_create_opts, Config),
 1229:     ConfDir = ?config(manager_conf_dir,   Config),
 1230:     DbDir   = ?config(manager_db_dir,     Config),
 1231: 
 1232:     write_manager_conf(ConfDir),
 1233: 
 1234:     Opts = [{server,     [{verbosity, log}]},
 1235: 	    {net_if,     [{verbosity, silence}, {options, SCO}]},
 1236: 	    {note_store, [{verbosity, silence}]},
 1237: 	    {config,     [{verbosity, log}, {dir, ConfDir}, {db_dir, DbDir}]}],
 1238: 
 1239:     ?IPRINT("request start notification (1)"),
 1240:     Pid1 = snmpm:notify_started(10000),
 1241:     receive
 1242: 	{snmpm_start_timeout, Pid1} ->
 1243: 	    ?IPRINT("received expected start timeout"),
 1244: 	    ok;
 1245: 	Any1 ->
 1246: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_message, Any1})
 1247:     after 15000 ->
 1248: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_timeout, Pid1})
 1249:     end,
 1250: 
 1251:     ?IPRINT("request start notification (2)"),
 1252:     Pid2 = snmpm:notify_started(10000),
 1253: 
 1254:     ?IPRINT("start the snmpm starter"),
 1255:     Pid = snmpm_starter(Opts, 5000),
 1256: 
 1257:     ?IPRINT("await the start notification"),
 1258:     Ref = 
 1259: 	receive
 1260: 	    {snmpm_started, Pid2} ->
 1261: 		?IPRINT("received started message -> create the monitor"),
 1262: 		snmpm:monitor();
 1263: 	    Any2 ->
 1264: 		?FAIL({unexpected_message, Any2})
 1265: 	after 15000 ->
 1266: 		?FAIL({unexpected_timeout, Pid2})
 1267: 	end,
 1268: 
 1269:     ?IPRINT("[~p] make sure it has not already crashed...", [Ref]),
 1270:     receive
 1271: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Obj1, Reason1} ->
 1272: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_down, Obj1, Reason1})
 1273:     after 1000 ->
 1274: 	    ok
 1275:     end,
 1276: 
 1277:     ?IPRINT("stop the manager"),
 1278:     Pid ! {stop, self()}, %ok = snmpm:stop(),
 1279: 
 1280:     ?IPRINT("await the down-message"),
 1281:     receive
 1282: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Obj2, Reason2} ->
 1283: 	    ?IPRINT("received expected down-message: "
 1284:                     "~n   Obj2:    ~p"
 1285:                     "~n   Reason2: ~p", 
 1286:                     [Obj2, Reason2]),
 1287: 	    ok
 1288:     after 5000 ->
 1289: 	    ?FAIL(down_timeout)
 1290:     end,
 1291: 
 1292:     ?IPRINT("end"),
 1293:     ok.
 1294: 
 1295: 
 1296: snmpm_starter(Opts, To) ->
 1297:     Parent = self(),
 1298:     spawn(
 1299:       fun() -> 
 1300: 	      ?SLEEP(To), 
 1301: 	      ok = snmpm:start(Opts),
 1302: 	      receive
 1303: 		  {stop, Parent} ->
 1304: 		      snmpm:stop()
 1305: 	      end
 1306:       end).
 1307: 
 1308: 
 1309: %%======================================================================
 1310: 
 1311: notify_started02(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1312:     ?TC_TRY(notify_started02,
 1313:             fun() -> notify_started02_cond(Config) end,
 1314:             fun() -> do_notify_started02(Config) end).
 1315: 
 1316: notify_started02_cond(Config) ->
 1317:     LinuxVersionVerify = 
 1318: 	fun() ->
 1319:                 case os:version() of
 1320:                     V when V > {2, 6, 16} ->
 1321:                         ?IPRINT("(Linux) kernel version check: "
 1322:                                 "~p > {2, 6, 16} => *NO* SKIP", [V]),
 1323:                         false;
 1324:                     V ->
 1325:                         ?IPRINT("(Linux) kernel version check: "
 1326:                                 "~p =< {2, 6, 16}  => *SKIP*", [V]),
 1327:                         true
 1328: 		end
 1329: 	end,
 1330:     Skippable = [{unix, [{linux, LinuxVersionVerify}]}],
 1331:     Condition = fun() -> ?OS_BASED_SKIP(Skippable) end,
 1332:     ?NON_PC_TC_MAYBE_SKIP(Config, Condition).
 1333:     
 1334: do_notify_started02(Config) ->
 1335:     ?IPRINT("starting with Config: "
 1336:             "~n      ~p", [Config]),
 1337: 
 1338:     SCO     = ?config(socket_create_opts, Config),
 1339:     ConfDir = ?config(manager_conf_dir,   Config),
 1340:     DbDir   = ?config(manager_db_dir,     Config),
 1341: 
 1342:     write_manager_conf(ConfDir),
 1343: 
 1344:     Opts = [{server,     [{verbosity, log}]},
 1345: 	    {net_if,     [{verbosity, silence}, {options, SCO}]},
 1346: 	    {note_store, [{verbosity, silence}]},
 1347: 	    {config,     [{verbosity, debug}, {dir, ConfDir}, {db_dir, DbDir}]}],
 1348: 
 1349:     ?IPRINT("start snmpm client process"),
 1350:     NumIterations = 5,
 1351:     Pid1 = ns02_client_start(NumIterations),
 1352: 
 1353:     ?IPRINT("start snmpm ctrl (starter) process"),
 1354:     Pid2 = ns02_ctrl_start(Opts, NumIterations),
 1355: 
 1356:     %% On a reasonably fast machine, one iteration takes approx 4 seconds.
 1357:     %% We measure the first iteration, and then we wait for the remaining
 1358:     %% ones (4 in this case).
 1359:     ApproxStartTime =
 1360:         case ns02_client_await_approx_runtime(Pid1) of
 1361:             {ok, T} ->
 1362:                 T;
 1363:             {error, Reason} ->
 1364:                 %% Attempt cleanup just in case
 1365:                 exit(Pid1, kill),
 1366:                 exit(Pid2, kill),
 1367:                 ?FAIL(Reason);
 1368:             {skip, Reason} ->
 1369:                 %% Attempt cleanup just in case
 1370:                 exit(Pid1, kill),
 1371:                 exit(Pid2, kill),
 1372:                 ?SKIP(Reason)
 1373:         end,
 1374: 
 1375:     ?IPRINT("await snmpm client process exit (max ~p+10000 msec)", 
 1376:             [ApproxStartTime]),
 1377:     receive 
 1378:         %% We take this opportunity to check if we got a skip from
 1379:         %% the ctrl process.
 1380: 	{'EXIT', Pid2, {skip, SkipReason1}} ->
 1381: 	    ?SKIP(SkipReason1);
 1382: 	{'EXIT', Pid1, normal} ->
 1383: 	    ok;
 1384: 	{'EXIT', Pid1, {suite_failed, Reason1}} ->
 1385: 	    ?FAIL({client, Reason1});
 1386: 	{'EXIT', Pid1, Reason1} ->
 1387: 	    ?FAIL({client, Reason1})
 1388:     after ApproxStartTime + 10000 ->
 1389:             exit(Pid1, kill),
 1390:             exit(Pid2, kill),
 1391: 	    ?FAIL(timeout)
 1392:     end,
 1393: 	
 1394:     ?IPRINT("await snmpm starter process exit"),
 1395:     receive 
 1396: 	{'EXIT', Pid2, normal} ->
 1397: 	    ok;
 1398: 	{'EXIT', Pid2, {skip, SkipReason2}} ->
 1399:             %% In case of a race
 1400: 	    ?SKIP(SkipReason2);
 1401: 	{'EXIT', Pid2, Reason2} ->
 1402: 	    ?FAIL({ctrl, Reason2})
 1403:     after 5000 ->
 1404:             exit(Pid2, kill),
 1405: 	    ?FAIL(timeout)
 1406:     end,
 1407: 	
 1408:     ?IPRINT("end"),
 1409:     ok.
 1410: 
 1411: 
 1412: ns02_client_start(N) ->
 1413:     Self = self(),
 1414:     spawn_link(fun() -> ns02_client(Self, N) end).
 1415: 
 1416: ns02_client_await_approx_runtime(Pid) ->
 1417:     receive
 1418:         {?MODULE, client_time, Time} ->
 1419:             {ok, Time};
 1420:         {'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
 1421:             ?EPRINT("client (~p) failed: "
 1422:                     "~n      ~p", [Pid, Reason]),
 1423:             {error, Reason}
 1424:                 
 1425:     after 30000 ->
 1426:             %% Either something is *really* wrong or this machine 
 1427:             %% is dog slow. Either way, this is a skip-reason...
 1428:             {skip, approx_runtime_timeout}
 1429:     end.
 1430:     
 1431: 		       
 1432: ns02_client(Parent, N) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 1433:     put(tname, ns02_client),
 1434:     ?IPRINT("starting"),
 1435:     ns02_client_loop(Parent, 
 1436:                      dummy, snmpm:notify_started(?NS_TIMEOUT),
 1437:                      snmp_misc:now(ms), undefined,
 1438:                      N).
 1439: 
 1440: ns02_client_loop(_Parent, _Ref, _Pid, _Begin, _End, 0) ->
 1441:     %% ?IPRINT("loop -> done"),
 1442:     exit(normal);
 1443: ns02_client_loop(Parent, Ref, Pid, Begin, End, N) 
 1444:   when is_pid(Parent) andalso is_integer(Begin) andalso is_integer(End) ->
 1445:     %% ?IPRINT("loop -> [~w] inform parent: ~w, ~w => ~w", [N, Begin, End, End-Begin]),
 1446:     Parent ! {?MODULE, client_time, N*(End-Begin)},
 1447:     ns02_client_loop(undefined, Ref, Pid, snmp_misc:now(ms), undefined, N);    
 1448: ns02_client_loop(Parent, Ref, Pid, Begin, End, N) 
 1449:   when is_integer(Begin) andalso is_integer(End) ->
 1450:     %% ?IPRINT("loop -> [~w] entry when"
 1451:     %%   "~n      Ref:   ~p"
 1452:     %%   "~n      Pid:   ~p"
 1453:     %%   "~n      Begin: ~p"
 1454:     %%   "~n      End:   ~p", [N, Ref, Pid, Begin, End]),
 1455:     ns02_client_loop(Parent, Ref, Pid, snmp_misc:now(ms), undefined, N);    
 1456: ns02_client_loop(Parent, Ref, Pid, Begin, End, N) ->
 1457:     %% ?IPRINT("loop(await message) -> [~w] entry when"
 1458:     %%   "~n      Ref:   ~p"
 1459:     %%   "~n      Pid:   ~p"
 1460:     %%   "~n      Begin: ~p"
 1461:     %%   "~n      End:   ~p", [N, Ref, Pid, Begin, End]),
 1462:     receive
 1463: 	{snmpm_started, Pid} ->
 1464: 	    ?IPRINT("received expected started message (~w)", [N]),
 1465: 	    ns02_client_loop(Parent,
 1466:                              snmpm:monitor(), dummy,
 1467:                              Begin, End,
 1468:                              N);
 1469: 	{snmpm_start_timeout, Pid} ->
 1470: 	    ?EPRINT("unexpected timeout"),
 1471: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_start_timeout, Pid});
 1472: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Obj, Reason} ->
 1473: 	    ?IPRINT("received expected DOWN message (~w) with"
 1474:                     "~n   Obj:    ~p"
 1475:                     "~n   Reason: ~p", [N, Obj, Reason]),
 1476: 	    ns02_client_loop(Parent,
 1477:                              dummy, snmpm:notify_started(?NS_TIMEOUT),
 1478:                              Begin, snmp_misc:now(ms),
 1479:                              N-1)
 1480:     end.
 1481: 
 1482: ns02_ctrl_start(Opts, N) ->
 1483:     spawn_link(fun() -> ns02_ctrl(Opts, N) end).
 1484: 		       
 1485: ns02_ctrl(Opts, N) ->
 1486:     put(tname, ns02_ctrl),
 1487:     ?IPRINT("starting"),
 1488:     ns02_ctrl_loop(Opts, N).
 1489: 
 1490: 
 1491: %% We have seen that some times it takes unreasonably long time to
 1492: %% start the manager (it got "stuck" in snmpm_config). But since
 1493: %% we did not have enough verbosity, we do not know how far it got.
 1494: %% So, we try to monitor each start attempt. We allow 5 sec (just 
 1495: %% to give slow boxes a chance).
 1496: ns02_ctrl_loop(_Opts, 0) ->
 1497:     ?IPRINT("done"),
 1498:     exit(normal);
 1499: ns02_ctrl_loop(Opts, N) ->
 1500:     ?IPRINT("entry when N: ~p", [N]),
 1501:     ?SLEEP(2000),
 1502:     ?IPRINT("start manager"),
 1503:     TS1 = erlang:system_time(millisecond),
 1504:     {StarterPid, StarterMRef} =
 1505:         erlang:spawn_monitor(fun() -> exit(snmpm:start(Opts)) end),
 1506:     receive
 1507:         {'DOWN', StarterMRef, process, StarterPid, ok} ->
 1508:             TS2 = erlang:system_time(millisecond),
 1509:             ?IPRINT("manager started: ~w ms", [TS2-TS1]),
 1510:             ok
 1511:     after 5000 ->
 1512:             ?EPRINT("manager (~p) start timeout - kill", [StarterPid]),
 1513:             exit(StarterPid, kill),
 1514:             exit({skip, start_timeout})
 1515:     end,
 1516:     ?SLEEP(2000),
 1517:     ?IPRINT("stop manager"),
 1518:     ?SLEEP(100), % Give the verbosity to take effect...
 1519:     TS3 = erlang:system_time(millisecond),
 1520:     case snmpm:stop(5000) of
 1521:         ok ->
 1522:             TS4 = erlang:system_time(millisecond),
 1523:             ?IPRINT("manager stopped: ~p ms", [TS4-TS3]),
 1524:             ok;
 1525:         {error, timeout} ->
 1526:             ?EPRINT("manager stop timeout - kill (cleanup) and skip"),
 1527:             exit(whereis(snmpm_supervisor), kill),
 1528:             exit({skip, stop_timeout})
 1529:     end,
 1530:     ns02_ctrl_loop(Opts, N-1).
 1531: 
 1532: 
 1533: 
 1534: %%======================================================================
 1535: 
 1536: info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1537:     Pre = fun() ->
 1538:                   SCO     = ?config(socket_create_opts, Config),
 1539:                   ConfDir = ?config(manager_conf_dir,   Config),
 1540:                   DbDir   = ?config(manager_db_dir,     Config),
 1541: 
 1542:                   write_manager_conf(ConfDir),
 1543: 
 1544:                   Opts = [{server,     [{verbosity, trace}]},
 1545:                           {net_if,     [{verbosity, trace}, {options, SCO}]},
 1546:                           {note_store, [{verbosity, trace}]},
 1547:                           {config,    [{verbosity, trace}, 
 1548:                                        {dir,       ConfDir}, 
 1549:                                        {db_dir,    DbDir}]}],
 1550:                   ?IPRINT("try starting manager"),
 1551:                   ok = snmpm:start(Opts),
 1552:                   ?SLEEP(1000),
 1553:                   ok
 1554:           end,
 1555:     Case = fun(_) -> do_info(Config) end,
 1556:     Post = fun(_) ->
 1557:                    ?IPRINT("info verified, now try to stop"),
 1558:                    snmpm:stop(),
 1559:                    ?SLEEP(1000),
 1560:                    ok
 1561:            end,
 1562:     ?TC_TRY(info, Pre, Case, Post).
 1563: 
 1564: 
 1565: do_info(Config) ->
 1566:     ?IPRINT("starting with Config: "
 1567:             "~n      ~p", [Config]),
 1568: 
 1569:     ?IPRINT("get info"),
 1570:     Info = snmpm:info(), 
 1571:     ?IPRINT("got info, now verify: "
 1572:             "~n   ~p", [Info]),
 1573:     ok = verify_info( Info ),
 1574: 
 1575:     ?IPRINT("end"),
 1576:     ok.
 1577: 
 1578: verify_info(Info) when is_list(Info) ->
 1579:     Keys = [{server,     [process_memory, db_memory]},
 1580: 	    {config,     [process_memory, db_memory]},
 1581: 	    {net_if,     [process_memory, transport_info]},
 1582: 	    {note_store, [process_memory, db_memory]},
 1583: 	    stats_counters],
 1584:     try verify_info(Keys, Info)
 1585:     catch
 1586:         C:E:S ->
 1587:             ?IPRINT("Verification Failed: "
 1588:                     "~n      Class: ~p"
 1589:                     "~n      Error: ~p"
 1590:                     "~n      Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 1591:             {error, {verification_failed, C, E, S}}
 1592:     end;
 1593: verify_info(BadInfo) ->
 1594:     {error, {bad_info, BadInfo}}.
 1595: 
 1596: verify_info([], _) ->
 1597:     ?IPRINT("verified"),
 1598:     ok;
 1599: verify_info([Key|Keys], Info) when is_atom(Key) ->
 1600:     ?IPRINT("try verify '~p'", [Key]),
 1601:     case lists:keymember(Key, 1, Info) of
 1602: 	true ->
 1603: 	    verify_info(Keys, Info);
 1604: 	false ->
 1605:             ?IPRINT("Verification of '~p' failed", [Key]),
 1606: 	    {error, {missing_info, {Key, Info}}}
 1607:     end;
 1608: verify_info([{Key, SubKeys}|Keys], Info) ->
 1609:     ?IPRINT("try verify '~p' with sub-keys: "
 1610:             "~n      ~p", [Key, SubKeys]),    
 1611:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Info) of
 1612: 	{value, {Key, SubInfo}} ->
 1613:             SubInfo2 =
 1614:                 if is_list(SubInfo) -> SubInfo;
 1615:                    is_map(SubInfo)  -> maps:to_list(SubInfo)
 1616:                 end,
 1617:             ?IPRINT("try verify sub-key(s) with sub-info: "
 1618:                     "~n      (Sub-) Keys: ~p"
 1619:                     "~n      (Sub-) Info: ~p", [SubKeys, SubInfo2]),
 1620: 	    case verify_info(SubKeys, SubInfo2) of
 1621: 		ok ->
 1622: 		    verify_info(Keys, Info);
 1623: 		{error, {missing_info, {SubKey, _}}} ->
 1624:                     ?IPRINT("Verification of sub-key '~p' failed", [SubKey]),
 1625: 		    {error, {missing_subinfo, {Key, SubKey, Info}}}
 1626: 	    end;
 1627: 	false ->
 1628:             ?IPRINT("Verification of key '~p' failed", [Key]),
 1629: 	    {error, {missing_info, {Key, Info}}}
 1630:     end.
 1631: 
 1632: 
 1633: %%======================================================================
 1634: 
 1635: %% USM privacy fails with AES in OTP 22.2.3. Test to prevent
 1636: %% regression in future releases.
 1637: %%
 1638: usm_priv_aes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1639:     Pre = fun() ->
 1640:                   SCO     = ?config(socket_create_opts, Config),
 1641:                   ConfDir = ?config(manager_conf_dir,   Config),
 1642:                   DbDir   = ?config(manager_db_dir,     Config),
 1643: 
 1644:                   write_manager_conf(ConfDir),
 1645: 
 1646:                   Opts = [{server,     [{verbosity, trace}]},
 1647:                           {net_if,     [{verbosity, trace}, {options, SCO}]},
 1648:                           {note_store, [{verbosity, trace}]},
 1649:                           {config,     [{verbosity, trace},
 1650:                                         {dir,       ConfDir},
 1651:                                         {db_dir,    DbDir}]}],
 1652: 
 1653:                   ?IPRINT("try starting manager"),
 1654:                   ok = snmpm:start(Opts),
 1655:                   ?SLEEP(1000), % Give it time to settle
 1656:                   ok
 1657:           end,
 1658:     Case = fun(_) -> do_usm_priv_aes(sha, Config) end,
 1659:     Post = fun(_) ->
 1660:                    ?IPRINT("try stop manager"),
 1661:                    ok = snmpm:stop(),
 1662:                    ?SLEEP(1000), % Give it time to settle
 1663:                    ok
 1664:            end,
 1665:     ?TC_TRY(usm_priv_aes, Pre, Case, Post).
 1666: 
 1667: 
 1668: %%======================================================================
 1669: 
 1670: usm_sha224_priv_aes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1671:     Pre = fun() ->
 1672:                   SCO     = ?config(socket_create_opts, Config),
 1673:                   ConfDir = ?config(manager_conf_dir,   Config),
 1674:                   DbDir   = ?config(manager_db_dir,     Config),
 1675: 
 1676:                   write_manager_conf(ConfDir),
 1677: 
 1678:                   Opts = [{server,     [{verbosity, trace}]},
 1679:                           {net_if,     [{verbosity, trace}, {options, SCO}]},
 1680:                           {note_store, [{verbosity, trace}]},
 1681:                           {config,     [{verbosity, trace},
 1682:                                         {dir,       ConfDir},
 1683:                                         {db_dir,    DbDir}]}],
 1684: 
 1685:                   ?IPRINT("try starting manager"),
 1686:                   ok = snmpm:start(Opts),
 1687:                   ?SLEEP(1000), % Give it time to settle
 1688:                   ok
 1689:           end,
 1690:     Case = fun(_) -> do_usm_priv_aes(sha224, Config) end,
 1691:     Post = fun(_) ->
 1692:                    ?IPRINT("try stop manager"),
 1693:                    ok = snmpm:stop(),
 1694:                    ?SLEEP(1000), % Give it time to settle
 1695:                    ok
 1696:            end,
 1697:     ?TC_TRY(usm_sha224_priv_aes, Pre, Case, Post).
 1698:

 1794: 
 1795: 
 1796: select_auth_proto(md5)    -> usmHMACMD5AuthProtocol;
 1797: select_auth_proto(sha)    -> usmHMACSHAAuthProtocol;
 1798: select_auth_proto(sha224) -> usmHMAC128SHA224AuthProtocol;
 1799: select_auth_proto(sha256) -> usmHMAC192SHA256AuthProtocol;
 1800: select_auth_proto(sha384) -> usmHMAC256SHA384AuthProtocol;
 1801: select_auth_proto(sha512) -> usmHMAC384SHA512AuthProtocol.
 1802: 
 1803: do_usm_priv_aes(AuthAlg, Config) ->
 1804:     ?IPRINT("starting with Config: "
 1805:             "~n   AuthAlg: ~p"
 1806:             "~n   Config:  ~p", [AuthAlg, Config]),
 1807: 
 1808:     put(sname,     "TC[usm-priv-aes]"),
 1809:     put(verbosity, trace),
 1810: 
 1811:     ?IPRINT("generate AES-encrypted message"),
 1812: 
 1813:     EngineID = [128,0,0,0,6],
 1814:     SecName  = "v3_user",
 1815:     AuthPass = "authpass",
 1816:     AuthKey  =
 1817:       snmp:passwd2localized_key(AuthAlg, AuthPass, EngineID),
 1818:     PrivPass = "privpass",
 1819:     PrivKey  =
 1820:       snmp:passwd2localized_key(md5, PrivPass, EngineID),
 1821: 
 1822:     Credentials =
 1823:       [ {auth,     select_auth_proto(AuthAlg)},
 1824:         {auth_key, AuthKey},
 1825:         {priv,     usmAesCfb128Protocol},
 1826:         {priv_key, PrivKey}
 1827:       ],
 1828: 
 1829:     AgentConfig =
 1830:       [ {engine_id, EngineID},
 1831:         {address,   {192,0,2,1}},
 1832:         {version,   v3},
 1833:         {sec_model, usm},
 1834:         {sec_level, authPriv},
 1835:         {sec_name,  SecName}
 1836:       ],
 1837: 
 1838:     ?IPRINT("register user, usm-user and agent"),
 1839:     snmpm:register_user(SecName, snmpm_user_default, nil),
 1840:     snmpm:register_usm_user(EngineID, SecName, Credentials),
 1841:     snmpm:register_agent(SecName, "v3_agent", AgentConfig),
 1842: 
 1843:     PduType   = 'get-request',
 1844:     ScopedPDU =
 1845:       { scopedPdu,
 1846:         "",        % CtxEngineID
 1847:         "",        % Context
 1848:         { pdu,
 1849:           PduType,
 1850:           0,       % RequestID
 1851:           noError, % ErrorStatus
 1852:           0,       % ErrorIndex
 1853:           [ {varbind, [1,3,6,1,2,1,1,5,0], 'OCTET STRING', [], 0}
 1854:           ]
 1855:         }
 1856:       },
 1857: 
 1858:     MsgSecurityParameters =
 1859:       { usmSecurityParameters,
 1860:         _MsgAuthoritativeEngineID    = EngineID,
 1861:         _MsgAuthoritativeEngineBoots = 1,
 1862:         _MsgAuthoritativeEngineTime  = 0,
 1863:         _MsgUserName                 = SecName,
 1864:         _MsgAuthenticationParameters = AuthKey,
 1865:         _MsgPrivacyParameters        = PrivKey
 1866:       },
 1867: 
 1868:     ?IPRINT("get engine mms"),
 1869:     {ok, MsgMaxSize} =
 1870:       snmpm_config:get_engine_max_message_size(),
 1871: 
 1872:     ?IPRINT("encode scoped pdu"),
 1873:     Message =
 1874:       { message,
 1875:         'version-3',
 1876:         { v3_hdr,
 1877:           1, % MsgID1 
 1878:           MsgMaxSize,
 1879:           snmp_misc:mk_msg_flags(PduType, 2), % MsgFlags1
 1880:           _MsgSecurityModel = 3,  % SEC_USM
 1881:           MsgSecurityParameters,
 1882:           0
 1883:         },
 1884:         Data = snmp_pdus:enc_scoped_pdu(ScopedPDU)
 1885:       },
 1886: 
 1887:     {_, CredVals} = lists:unzip(Credentials),
 1888: 
 1889:     SecLevel = 2,
 1890: 
 1891:     ?IPRINT("generate outgoing message"),
 1892:     Msg =
 1893:       snmpm_usm:generate_outgoing_msg(
 1894:         Message,
 1895:         EngineID,
 1896:         SecName,
 1897:         list_to_tuple([SecName|CredVals]),
 1898:         SecLevel
 1899:       ),
 1900: 
 1901:     ?IPRINT("got AES-encrypted message, now decrypt: "
 1902:             "~n   ~p", [Msg]),
 1903: 
 1904:     {message, _Version, Hdr, NextData} =
 1905:       snmp_pdus:dec_message_only(Msg),
 1906: 
 1907:     ?IPRINT("AES-encrypted message decrypted - now match"),
 1908: 
 1909:     { v3_hdr,
 1910:       _MsgID,
 1911:       _MsgMaxSize,
 1912:       _MsgFlags,
 1913:       _SecModel,
 1914:       SecParams,
 1915:       _Hdr_size
 1916:     } = Hdr,
 1917: 
 1918:     ?IPRINT("process incoming message"),
 1919: 
 1920:     { ok,
 1921:       { _MsgAuthEngineID,
 1922:         _SecName,
 1923:         ScopedPDUBytes,
 1924:         _CachedSecData
 1925:       }
 1926:     } =
 1927:       snmpm_usm:process_incoming_msg(
 1928:         Msg,
 1929:         NextData,
 1930:         SecParams,
 1931:         SecLevel
 1932:       ),
 1933: 
 1934:     Data = ScopedPDUBytes,
 1935: 
 1936:     ?IPRINT("message decrypted"),
 1937:     ok.
 1938: 
 1939: 
 1940: %%======================================================================
 1941: 
 1942: register_user1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1943:     Pre  = fun() ->
 1944:                    ManagerNode = start_node(register_user1),
 1945:                    [ManagerNode]
 1946:            end,
 1947:     Case = fun(State) -> do_register_user1(State, Config) end,
 1948:     Post = fun([{ManagerPeer, _ManagerNode}]) -> peer:stop(ManagerPeer) end,
 1949:     ?TC_TRY(register_user1, Pre, Case, Post).
 1950: 
 1951: do_register_user1([{_ManagerPeer, ManagerNode}], Config) ->
 1952:     ?IPRINT("starting with Config: "
 1953:             "~n   ~p"
 1954:             "~n", [Config]),
 1955: 
 1956:     SCO     = ?config(socket_create_opts, Config),
 1957:     ConfDir = ?config(manager_conf_dir,   Config),
 1958:     DbDir   = ?config(manager_db_dir,     Config),
 1959: 
 1960:     write_manager_conf(ConfDir),
 1961: 
 1962:     Opts = [{server,     [{verbosity, trace}]},
 1963: 	    {net_if,     [{verbosity, trace}, {options, SCO}]},
 1964: 	    {note_store, [{verbosity, trace}]},
 1965: 	    {config, [{verbosity, trace}, {dir, ConfDir}, {db_dir, DbDir}]}],
 1966: 
 1967: 
 1968:     ?IPRINT("load snmp application"),
 1969:     ok = load_snmp(ManagerNode),
 1970: 
 1971:     ?IPRINT("set manager env for the snmp application"),
 1972:     ok = set_mgr_env(ManagerNode, Opts),
 1973: 
 1974:     ?IPRINT("starting snmp application (with only manager)"),
 1975:     ok = start_snmp(ManagerNode),
 1976: 
 1977:     ?IPRINT("started"),
 1978: 
 1979:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 1980: 
 1981:     ?IPRINT("manager info: ~p~n", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 1982: 
 1983:     ?IPRINT("try register user(s)"),
 1984:     ok = mgr_register_user(ManagerNode, calvin, snmpm_user_default,
 1985: 				 [self(), "various misc info"]),
 1986: 
 1987:     Users1 = mgr_which_users(ManagerNode),
 1988:     ?IPRINT("users: ~p~n", [Users1]),
 1989:     ok = verify_users(Users1, [calvin]),
 1990:     ?IPRINT("manager info: ~p~n", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 1991: 
 1992:     ok = mgr_register_user(ManagerNode, hobbe, snmpm_user_default,
 1993: 				 {"misc info", self()}),
 1994: 
 1995:     Users2 = mgr_which_users(ManagerNode),
 1996:     ?IPRINT("users: ~p~n", [Users2]),
 1997:     ok = verify_users(Users2, [calvin, hobbe]),
 1998:     ?IPRINT("manager info: ~p~n", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 1999: 
 2000:     ?IPRINT("try unregister user(s)"),
 2001:     ok = mgr_unregister_user(ManagerNode, calvin),
 2002: 
 2003:     Users3 = mgr_which_users(ManagerNode),
 2004:     ?IPRINT("users: ~p~n", [Users3]),
 2005:     ok = verify_users(Users3, [hobbe]),
 2006:     ?IPRINT("manager info: ~p~n", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 2007: 
 2008:     ok = mgr_unregister_user(ManagerNode, hobbe),
 2009: 
 2010:     Users4 = mgr_which_users(ManagerNode),
 2011:     ?IPRINT("users: ~p~n", [Users4]),
 2012:     ok = verify_users(Users4, []),
 2013:     ?IPRINT("manager info: ~p~n", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 2014: 
 2015:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 2016: 
 2017:     ?IPRINT("stop snmp application (with only manager)"),
 2018:     ok = stop_snmp(ManagerNode),
 2019: 
 2020:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 2021: 
 2022:     ok.
 2023: 
 2024: verify_users([], []) ->
 2025:     ok;
 2026: verify_users(ActualUsers, []) ->
 2027:     {error, {unexpected_users, ActualUsers}};
 2028: verify_users(ActualUsers0, [User|RegUsers]) ->
 2029:     case lists:delete(User, ActualUsers0) of
 2030: 	ActualUsers0 ->
 2031: 	    {error, {not_registered, User}};
 2032: 	ActualUsers ->
 2033: 	    verify_users(ActualUsers, RegUsers)
 2034:     end.
 2035:     
 2036:

 2039: register_agent_old() ->
 2040:     [{doc, "Test registration of agents with the OLD interface functions"}].
 2041: 
 2042: register_agent_old(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2043:     Pre  = fun() ->
 2044:                    ManagerNode = start_node(register_agent_old),
 2045:                    [ManagerNode]
 2046:            end,
 2047:     Case = fun(State) -> do_register_agent_old(State, Config) end,
 2048:     Post = fun([{ManagerPeer, _ManagerNode}]) -> peer:stop(ManagerPeer) end,
 2049:     ?TC_TRY(register_agent_old, Pre, Case, Post).
 2050: 
 2051: do_register_agent_old([{_ManagerPeer, ManagerNode}], Config) ->
 2052:     ?IPRINT("starting with Config: "
 2053:             "~n      ~p"
 2054:             "~n", [Config]),
 2055: 
 2056:     SCO     = ?config(socket_create_opts, Config),
 2057:     ConfDir = ?config(manager_conf_dir,   Config),
 2058:     DbDir   = ?config(manager_db_dir,     Config),
 2059: 
 2060:     write_manager_conf(ConfDir),
 2061: 
 2062:     Opts = [{server,     [{verbosity, trace}]},
 2063: 	    {net_if,     [{verbosity, trace}, {options, SCO}]},
 2064: 	    {note_store, [{verbosity, trace}]},
 2065: 	    {config, [{verbosity, trace}, {dir, ConfDir}, {db_dir, DbDir}]}],
 2066: 
 2067: 
 2068:     ?IPRINT("load snmp application"),
 2069:     ok = load_snmp(ManagerNode),
 2070: 
 2071:     ?IPRINT("set manager env for the snmp application"),
 2072:     ok = set_mgr_env(ManagerNode, Opts),
 2073: 
 2074:     ?IPRINT("starting snmp application (with only manager)"),
 2075:     ok = start_snmp(ManagerNode),
 2076: 
 2077:     ?IPRINT("started"),
 2078: 
 2079:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 2080: 
 2081:     ?IPRINT("manager info: ~p~n", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 2082: 
 2083:     ?IPRINT("register user(s) user_alfa & user_beta"),
 2084:     ok = mgr_register_user(ManagerNode, user_alfa, snmpm_user_default, []),
 2085:     ok = mgr_register_user(ManagerNode, user_beta, snmpm_user_default, []),
 2086:     ?IPRINT("manager info: ~p~n", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 2087: 
 2088:     ?IPRINT("register agent(s)"),
 2089:     ok = mgr_register_agent(ManagerNode, user_alfa, 5000, []),
 2090:     ok = mgr_register_agent(ManagerNode, user_alfa, 5001, []),
 2091:     ok = mgr_register_agent(ManagerNode, user_beta, 5002, []),
 2092:     ok = mgr_register_agent(ManagerNode, user_beta, 5003, []),
 2093: 
 2094:     ?IPRINT("verify all agent(s): expect 4"),
 2095:     case mgr_which_agents(ManagerNode) of
 2096: 	Agents1 when length(Agents1) =:= 4 ->
 2097: 	    ?IPRINT("all agents: ~p~n", [Agents1]),
 2098: 	    ok;
 2099: 	Agents1 ->
 2100: 	    ?FAIL({agent_registration_failure, Agents1})
 2101:     end,
 2102: 
 2103:     ?IPRINT("verify user_alfa agent(s)"),
 2104:     case mgr_which_agents(ManagerNode, user_alfa) of
 2105: 	Agents2 when length(Agents2) =:= 2 ->
 2106: 	    ?IPRINT("calvin agents: ~p", [Agents2]),
 2107: 	    ok;
 2108: 	Agents2 ->
 2109: 	    ?FAIL({agent_registration_failure, Agents2})
 2110:     end,
 2111: 
 2112:     ?IPRINT("verify user_beta agent(s)"),
 2113:     case mgr_which_agents(ManagerNode, user_beta) of
 2114: 	Agents3 when length(Agents3) =:= 2 ->
 2115: 	    ?IPRINT("hobbe agents: ~p", [Agents3]),
 2116: 	    ok;
 2117: 	Agents3 ->
 2118: 	    ?FAIL({agent_registration_failure, Agents3})
 2119:     end,
 2120: 
 2121:     ?IPRINT("manager info: "
 2122:             "~n      ~p", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 2123:     
 2124:     ?IPRINT("unregister user user_alfa"),
 2125:     ok = mgr_unregister_user(ManagerNode, user_alfa),
 2126: 
 2127:     ?IPRINT("verify all agent(s): expect 2"),
 2128:     case mgr_which_agents(ManagerNode) of
 2129: 	Agents4 when length(Agents4) =:= 2 ->
 2130: 	    ?IPRINT("all agents: ~p", [Agents4]),
 2131: 	    ok;
 2132: 	Agents4 ->
 2133: 	    ?FAIL({agent_unregistration_failure, Agents4})
 2134:     end,
 2135:     ?IPRINT("manager info: "
 2136:             "~n      ~p~n", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 2137: 
 2138:     ?IPRINT("unregister user_beta agents"),
 2139:     ok = mgr_unregister_agent(ManagerNode, user_beta, 5002),
 2140:     ok = mgr_unregister_agent(ManagerNode, user_beta, 5003),
 2141: 
 2142:     ?IPRINT("verify all agent(s): expect 0"),
 2143:     case mgr_which_agents(ManagerNode) of
 2144: 	[] ->
 2145: 	    ok;
 2146: 	Agents5 ->
 2147: 	    ?IPRINT("all agents: ~p~n", [Agents5]),
 2148: 	    ?FAIL({agent_unregistration_failure, Agents5})
 2149:     end,
 2150: 
 2151:     ?IPRINT("manager info: "
 2152:             "~n      ~p", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 2153: 
 2154:     ?IPRINT("unregister user hobbe"),
 2155:     ok = mgr_unregister_user(ManagerNode, user_beta),
 2156: 
 2157:     ?IPRINT("manager info: "
 2158:             "~n      ~p", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 2159: 
 2160:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 2161: 
 2162:     ?IPRINT("stop snmp application (with only manager)"),
 2163:     ok = stop_snmp(ManagerNode),
 2164: 
 2165:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 2166:     ?IPRINT("end"),
 2167: 
 2168:     ok.
 2169:

 2173: register_agent2() ->
 2174:     [{doc, "Test registration of agents with the NEW interface functions"}].
 2175: 
 2176: register_agent2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2177:     Pre  = fun() ->
 2178:                    ManagerNode = start_node(register_agent2),
 2179:                    [ManagerNode]
 2180:            end,
 2181:     Case = fun(State) -> do_register_agent2(State, Config) end,
 2182:     Post = fun([{ManagerPeer, _ManagerNode}]) -> peer:stop(ManagerPeer) end,
 2183:     ?TC_TRY(register_agent2, Pre, Case, Post).
 2184: 
 2185: do_register_agent2([{_ManagerPeer, ManagerNode}], Config) ->
 2186:     ?IPRINT("starting with Config: "
 2187:             "~n      ~p", [Config]),
 2188: 
 2189:     SCO       = ?config(socket_create_opts, Config),
 2190:     ConfDir   = ?config(manager_conf_dir,   Config),
 2191:     DbDir     = ?config(manager_db_dir,     Config),
 2192:     LocalHost = snmp_test_lib:localhost(), 
 2193: 
 2194:     write_manager_conf(ConfDir),
 2195: 
 2196:     Opts = [{server,     [{verbosity, trace}]},
 2197: 	    {net_if,     [{verbosity, trace}, {options, SCO}]},
 2198: 	    {note_store, [{verbosity, trace}]},
 2199: 	    {config, [{verbosity, trace}, {dir, ConfDir}, {db_dir, DbDir}]}],
 2200: 
 2201:     ?IPRINT("load snmp application"),
 2202:     ok = load_snmp(ManagerNode),
 2203: 
 2204:     ?IPRINT("set manager env for the snmp application"),
 2205:     ok = set_mgr_env(ManagerNode, Opts),
 2206: 
 2207:     ?IPRINT("starting snmp application (with only manager)"),
 2208:     ok = start_snmp(ManagerNode),
 2209: 
 2210:     ?IPRINT("started"),
 2211: 
 2212:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 2213: 
 2214:     ?IPRINT("manager info: ~p~n", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 2215: 
 2216:     ?IPRINT("register user(s) user_alfa & user_beta"),
 2217:     ok = mgr_register_user(ManagerNode, user_alfa, snmpm_user_default, []),
 2218:     ok = mgr_register_user(ManagerNode, user_beta, snmpm_user_default, []),
 2219:     ?IPRINT("manager info: ~p~n", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 2220: 
 2221:     ?IPRINT("register agent(s)"),
 2222:     TargetName1 = "agent1", 
 2223:     ok = mgr_register_agent(ManagerNode, user_alfa, TargetName1,
 2224: 				  [{address,   LocalHost},
 2225: 				   {port,      5001},
 2226: 				   {engine_id, "agentEngineId-1"}]),
 2227:     TargetName2 = "agent2", 
 2228:     ok = mgr_register_agent(ManagerNode, user_alfa, TargetName2,
 2229: 				  [{address,   LocalHost},
 2230: 				   {port,      5002},
 2231: 				   {engine_id, "agentEngineId-2"}]),
 2232:     TargetName3 = "agent3", 
 2233:     ok = mgr_register_agent(ManagerNode, user_beta, TargetName3,
 2234: 				  [{address,   LocalHost},
 2235: 				   {port,      5003},
 2236: 				   {engine_id, "agentEngineId-3"}]),
 2237:     TargetName4 = "agent4", 
 2238:     ok = mgr_register_agent(ManagerNode, user_beta, TargetName4,
 2239: 				  [{address,   LocalHost},
 2240: 				   {port,      5004},
 2241: 				   {engine_id, "agentEngineId-4"}]),
 2242: 
 2243:     ?IPRINT("verify all agent(s): expect 4"),
 2244:     case mgr_which_agents(ManagerNode) of
 2245: 	Agents1 when length(Agents1) =:= 4 ->
 2246: 	    ?IPRINT("all agents: ~p~n", [Agents1]),
 2247: 	    ok;
 2248: 	Agents1 ->
 2249: 	    ?FAIL({agent_registration_failure, Agents1})
 2250:     end,
 2251: 
 2252:     ?IPRINT("verify user_alfa agent(s)"),
 2253:     case mgr_which_agents(ManagerNode, user_alfa) of
 2254: 	Agents2 when length(Agents2) =:= 2 ->
 2255: 	    ?IPRINT("calvin agents: ~p~n", [Agents2]),
 2256: 	    ok;
 2257: 	Agents2 ->
 2258: 	    ?FAIL({agent_registration_failure, Agents2})
 2259:     end,
 2260: 
 2261:     ?IPRINT("verify user_beta agent(s)"),
 2262:     case mgr_which_agents(ManagerNode, user_beta) of
 2263: 	Agents3 when length(Agents3) =:= 2 ->
 2264: 	    ?IPRINT("hobbe agents: ~p~n", [Agents3]),
 2265: 	    ok;
 2266: 	Agents3 ->
 2267: 	    ?FAIL({agent_registration_failure, Agents3})
 2268:     end,
 2269: 
 2270:     ?IPRINT("manager info: ~p~n", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 2271: 
 2272:     ?IPRINT("unregister user user_alfa"),
 2273:     ok = mgr_unregister_user(ManagerNode, user_alfa),
 2274: 
 2275:     ?IPRINT("verify all agent(s): expect 2"),
 2276:     case mgr_which_agents(ManagerNode) of
 2277: 	Agents4 when length(Agents4) =:= 2 ->
 2278: 	    ?IPRINT("all agents: ~p~n", [Agents4]),
 2279: 	    ok;
 2280: 	Agents4 ->
 2281: 	    ?FAIL({agent_unregistration_failure, Agents4})
 2282:     end,
 2283:     ?IPRINT("manager info: ~p~n", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 2284: 
 2285:     ?IPRINT("unregister user_beta agents"),
 2286:     ok = mgr_unregister_agent(ManagerNode, user_beta, TargetName3),
 2287:     ok = mgr_unregister_agent(ManagerNode, user_beta, TargetName4),
 2288: 
 2289:     ?IPRINT("verify all agent(s): expect 0"),
 2290:     case mgr_which_agents(ManagerNode) of
 2291: 	[] ->
 2292: 	    ok;
 2293: 	Agents5 ->
 2294: 	    ?IPRINT("all agents: ~p~n", [Agents5]),
 2295: 	    ?FAIL({agent_unregistration_failure, Agents5})
 2296:     end,
 2297: 
 2298:     ?IPRINT("manager info: ~p~n", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 2299: 
 2300:     ?IPRINT("unregister user user_beta"),
 2301:     ok = mgr_unregister_user(ManagerNode, user_beta),
 2302: 
 2303:     ?IPRINT("manager info: ~p~n", [mgr_info(ManagerNode)]),
 2304: 
 2305:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 2306: 
 2307:     ?IPRINT("stop snmp application (with only manager)"),
 2308:     ok = stop_snmp(ManagerNode),
 2309: 
 2310:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 2311: 
 2312:     ok.
 2313:
